title: Resources - Safe Sleep
description: Did You know? Did you know that as of November 12, 2022, manufacturers in the U.S. are no longer allowed to produce, market or sell inclined sleepers for infants or crib bumpers? [...]
cleaned_text: Did You know? - Did you know that as of November 12, 2022, manufacturers in the U.S. are no longer allowed to produce, market or sell inclined sleepers for infants or crib bumpers? To Learn More, visit: [Safe Sleep for Babies Act Business Guidance from the Consumer Product Safety Commission](https://www.cpsc.gov/Business--Manufacturing/Business-Education/Business-Guidance/Safe-Sleep-for-Babies-Act-Business-Guidance#:~:text=117%2D126%2C%20the%20Safe%20Sleep,2057) - You can learn about recent Sleep product recalls at [Safe Sleep - Cribs and Infant Products | CPSC.gov](https://www.cpsc.gov/SafeSleep) - You can click here to learn about Safe to Sleep® [public education campaign](http://www.nichd.nih.gov/sts/Pages/default.aspx)led by The Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD) of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and in collaboration with other organizations. - KID is a nonprofit organization dedicated to children's product safety.
